result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina M. Sorrentino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Unpaid financial obligations on Counts 2 & 3 are to be paid while on supervison on Count 1.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Unpaid financial obligations on Counts 2 & 3 are to be paid while on supervison on Count 1.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: No Huber is allowed until DE graduates from the Living Free Progrqm at which time huber will be authorized for work, child care and ELM.

records.addlTxt:
Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  (Court Reporter: Betsy K.)  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 1-  Court Imposes and Stays 3 years in the WSP with 1 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence in Count 1 is stayed and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  As a condition she is ordered to serve 50 days in the KCJ forthwith.  No Huber is allowed until DE graduates from the Living Free Program at which time huber will be authorized for work, child care and electronic leg monitor.  Court costs & DNA Surcharge ordered.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   
Count 2 - Defendant previously revoked and is sentenced to 102 days in the KCJ consecutive to Count 1 - Credit for 102 days (TIME SERVED).  
Count 3 - Defendant previously revoked and is sentenced to 30 days in the KCJ consecutive to Count 1 - Credit for 30 days (TIME SERVED).   
Any remaining costs owed in Counts 2 & 3 are to be paid during supervision in Count 1.
Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
filed by Agent Schwartz

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 1-31-17; to be returned to court for sentencing.  Balance still due.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Phan indicates that she spoke with the probation agent, who has extended the probation to October 2017, and that the DE will be able to pay the outstanding financial obligations by January, at which point the agent's intention is to discharge her early.  The parties request a new deferred prosecution agreement hearing date at the end of January to allow the DE time to pay the balances due.  Court sets DPAH for 2/24/17 @ 10:00.

Petition and Stipulation to waive appearance and hearing and Order Extending Probation for unpaid court obligations.   Defts probation is extended for 1 year from 10-8-16 to 10-8-17 or until all court obligations are completed.
